item.title: Earthquake | Number of dead in Myanmar increases to 3,471
item.description: The death toll of March 28 in Myanmar increased to 3,471, with more than 4,600 injured and 214 missing, yesterday the military junta in power in the country. The Armed Forces released this new balance through Myanmar's Global New Light newspaper, at a time when rescue teams, including some foreigners, continue to remove rubble and look for missing. The previous balance, released on Saturday, pointed to 3,354 dead, 4,850 injured and 220 missing, having been rescued by 653 people. The 7.7 magnitude earthquake has reached a large area of ​​the country, causing significant damage to six regions and states, including the capital Nayphitaw, leaving many areas without energy and communications. The shake also aggravated the humanitarian crisis triggered by the country's civil war, which internally moved more than three million people, according to the United Nations. Military Government leader General Min Aung Hlaing said that the earthquake was the second strongest in the country's history after the magnitude 8 earthquake of Mandalay in May 1912. Global Aids The regime also explained that more than 150 tons of humanitarian aid - from countries such as China, the United States, Singapore, India and Thailand - entered the country since the earthquake. An estimate mentions collapse or partial damage in at least 21,783 houses, 805 office buildings, 1,690 pagodas, 1,041 schools, 921 monasteries and convents, 312 religious buildings, 48 ​​hospitals and 18 hectares of plantations. Min Aung Hlaing, confirmed - in another article published yesterday by the official newspaper - the plan to build temporary schools to ensure that children return to class as soon as possible. The Armed Forces returned yesterday to accuse the ethnic guerrillas and the democratic opposition to commit “terrorist acts”, referring to alleged attacks on state and military facilities, in the midst of territorial dispute that has worsened since the coup d'état of February 2021. The military and various armed resistance groups declared a temporary ceasefire on Wednesday, after the earthquake, to facilitate the flow of humanitarian aid. On Wednesday, the United Nations Office for Human Rights accused the Military Board of not respecting the ceasefire, having made at least 16 attacks since the truce and a total of 61 since the earthquake. On March 28, a 7.7 magnitude earthquake on the Richter scale, with epicenter in Myanmar (former Burma) was felt in several Southeast Asia countries, including Thailand, where a total of 22 people died in the capital.

item.title: WONG KIT CHENG calls for response to increased youth crime
item.description: Deputy Wong Kit Cheng is concerned about youth crime and intends to know how the authorities will deal with the problem. The subject is addressed through written interpellation, in which the legislator linked to the General Association of Macao Women of Macau points out that last year the levels of crime among the youngest exceeded 2023, with great growth compared to 2019. Based on official numbers, the deputy indicates that last year 131 cases of juvenile delinquency were recorded, an increase of 23 cases compared to 2019, the last year before the pandemic, the data show an increase of 71 cases of juvenile delinquency last year. At the same time, the number of young people involved in crimes rose to 181, which represented an increase of 30 young people compared to 2023, when there were 151 young people detected in criminal activities. "The numbers reflect a continuous trend of increased youth crime in recent years, which is a cause for concern," warns Wong. "Young people are socially inexperienced and curious about new things, so they are easily enticed by unscrupulous people to get involved in illegal acts," he added. Parallel trade Among the activities that have enlisted the younger ones, Wong Kit Cheng indicated parallel trade, in which young people are used to illegally transport the interior, goods that are later resold. However, the deputy also recalled the cases of young people attracted to job offers to Taiwan and Cambodia, where they were involved in burlage schemes. "The community expects authorities to intensify the work of preventing and eliminating youth crime, which develop it in depth and in the light of the evolution of the social environment and the patterns of crime," was indicated. Women's deputies ask the political authorities to deal with the phenomenon and to have plans to ensure that young people have room to grow in a healthy environment, without being enticed to criminal activities. In addition, measures are also requested, not only to punish the younger ones, but also to ensure that they become integrated into society after the penalties are fulfilled.

item.title: Lusophone exports to China fall more than 30% until February
item.description: Exports from Portuguese -speaking countries to China fell 30.7 percent in the first two months of 2025, compared to the same period last year. According to information from China's customs services, in January and February the Lusophone Block sold goods of $ 17 billion to the Chinese market. According to the data, gathered by the Forum for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries (Macao Forum), this is the lowest value for the first two months of a year since 2021, in the middle of COVID - 19 pandemic. The descent was due mainly to the largest Lusophone supplier in the Chinese market, Brazil, whose sales fell one third (33.4 percent) to $ 13.7 billion. In addition, also the second largest Chinese commercial partner in the Lusophone block, Angola, saw exports decrease 16.4 percent to $ 2.37 billion. Also the sales of goods from Portugal to China decreased by 13 percent to $ 444.4 million. On the contrary, the exports of Mozambique rose more than one third (34.4 percent) to $ 332.2 million. Equatorial Guinea exports to the Chinese market dropped 71.2 percent to $ 85.6 million, while Timor-Leste sales shred 98 percent. The exports of Sao Tome and Principe also fell 53.3 percent, although the country did not sell more than 1,000 dollars in goods. Already Cape Verde and Guinea-Bissau did not sell any merchandise to China in the first two months of 2025. On the other hand In the opposite direction, Chinese exports to Portuguese -speaking countries also reduced 9 percent to $ 12.2 billion. The data reveal that Brazil was the largest buyer in the Lusophone block, with imports from China to reach $ 10.3 billion, a drop of 7.8 percent in annual terms. Second on the list comes Portugal, which bought the goods of $ 932.4 million, less than 10.5 percent than in the same period as 2024. China registered a commercial deficit of $ 4.78 billion with the Lusophone Block in the first two months of 2025. In all, trade between Portuguese -speaking countries and China reached $ 29.2 billion, less 23.1 percent than in the same period last year.

item.title: Painting exhibition in mineral pigments until the end of the month in Ka-Hó
item.description: The Hold On To Hope Gallery, located in Ka-Hó and managed by the Macao Toxicode Pexicodes Rehabilitation Association, presents until the 27th of this month an exhibition in partnership with the group “Questionmark Workshop”, entitled “China's Academy of Arts-Exhibition of Research Class Instructors and Creation in Mineral Painting”. According to a statement from ArtM, this exhibition “aims to promote the traditional art form of painting with mineral pigments, bringing together eight influential teachers from China and Japan in this area”. There are “unique creations in the area of ​​rock color painting, demonstrating a perfect fusion of this ancestral technique with modern art,” he adds. Mineral pigments painting is also described as "an important expressive technique in traditional Chinese painting, it is known for its rich colors and unique methods." Thus, it shows "not only highlights the individual styles of artists, but also reflects their deep understanding and innovative exploitation of rock color techniques." The artm considers that “each work of the artists carries a single narrative and emotion, aiming to provoke the reassessment and contemplation of the public about the culture of rock color”. With this exhibition, the public will be able to “experience the charm of painting with mineral pigments, feeling the beauty of the art that fuses tradition with modernity”. Who is who Regarding the participating artists in this show, the presence of works by Wang Xiong Fei, director of Rock Color Panting Institute in China Academy of Art [China Arts Academy], as well as Rector and Professor at the Institute of Eastern Art at Hebei University of Fine Arts [University of Fine Arts of Hebei]. You can also see works by Yiqiwava Yasumiqi, honorary teacher at Tama Art University, Japan; and vice president of Japan Art Academy. Another artist present is Yu LV Kui, graduated from the former Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts, currently China Academy of Arts, and former student at Tokyo Gakugei University in Japan. Zhang Lee, Wang Long, Li Han Ning, Sheng Xin Yi, Han Dian Liang are other artists who participate in this show with their art works.

item.title: Big Award Consumption | More than 130 disqualified residents
item.description:
Until March 30, the major consumption prize generated about 115 million patacas in business. According to government data, until Saturday, 131 residents involved in abnormal transactions had been detected, which were eventually disqualified from the initiative designed to stimulate consumption
During the first week of the Grand Prix of Consumption, that is, until March 30, "electronic benefits were used in the amount of more than 23.6 million patacas and immediate discount for elderly in the amount of about 6.15 million patacas." According to data released yesterday by the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), in the first week of the initiative, which started on March 24, consumption was generated of about 115 million patacas. Despite the growth of turnover, one of the likely failures in the system provided by the authorities confirmed itself. Until last Saturday, 131 users of payment institutions and online TakeAway platforms were identified involved in abnormal transactions, which were eventually “immediately disqualified to participate in this activity”, not being able to participate in discount coupons or use coupons draws, describes DSEDT. Anomal situations are found when residents get raffle opportunities with irregular means, after buying products more than 50 patacas on the “Takeaway Platform”. The irregularities were discovered through a joint supervision mechanism by DSEDT and payment institutions and TakeAway platforms, in order to "guarantee justice." Curteira aim More than 20,000 commercial establishments joined this edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption, accepting the electronic benefits and immediate discounts for the elderly. DSEDT adds that more than 120 of these stores and restaurants have launched "simultaneously, additional consumer offers." As the initiative aims to stimulate the business of small commerce and restoration of community neighborhoods, discounts cannot be used to pay water bills, electricity, natural gas, fuels, telecommunications services, transfronight transport, medical services, services provided by public institutions. Nor can they be used in casinos, banks, insurers and other financial institutions, pledge houses, large -scale supermarkets, property management, educational institutions, parking parks, taxis, parking meters, and automatic sales machines. The initiative will take place until June 1st.

item.title: Airport | Ratched cargo transportation to Madrid
item.description:
The first long -haul load route between Macau and Madrid is being operated by Ethiopia's Ethiopian Airlines company. The company's director for China argues that Macau is “an important platform” for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries
The first long-haul load route between Macao and Madrid tore off on Thursday with a Boeing 777F operated by Ethiopian Airlines, which raised flight from Macao International Airport (MIA). The Ethiopian airline will make two round -trip trips per week, and the 777F Boeing will mainly transport transfronic electronic trade goods, according to a note from the Mia Management company, to which Lusa had access. "The new route will further improve the air load network between Asia and Europe, providing more efficient logistical support for exports in the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau (GBA) area, and boosting logistical competitiveness." According to Mia Manager, Madrid is one of Europe's leading logistics centers, so "the opening of this new route will satisfy the growing demand for air load, while reinforcing connectivity between GBA and European markets," the load volumes are expected to be "increasing". Ethiopian Airlines' national director for China, Aman Wole Gurmu, cited in the note, said Macau is “an important platform” for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, so the launch of the new route will reinforce this role, constituting an air logistics corridor that will connect Europe and Asia. Fill in gaps "This new route not only fills the gap in cargo transportation between Macau and Spain, but also takes advantage of the local network in Spain to connect Macau to the markets in Africa and South America, forming a triangular logistics network" Asia-Africa-Europe "," according to Aman Wole Gurmu, although the chased network seems to be "quadrangular", given the inclusion of the American continent. "This will help Macao become a key center for transfronight exports of electronic trade and cargo transportation in the large bay area," he added. According to the Mia Management company, there is a constant growth in the cargo business in recent years, looking for air logistics to be driven by the rapid increase in transionic electronic trade, with Macau Airport involved in a load transport in the order of 108,000 tons in 2024.

item.title: Employment | Criticized bet on leavers from outside without experience
item.description:
Deputy Ron Lam accuses the government from having diverted the political intention of allowing local companies to hire non-residents with international experience and success, and instead be issuing residence permitted to young people without curriculum.
Legislator Ron Lam attacked the government's policy of allowing imports as “talents” of non -residents with academic education, but without any professional experience. Criticism arises in a written interpellation, where the member of the Legislative Assembly indicates that politics is inconsistent, since one is through a phase in which the unemployment of newly educated is becoming worse and worse. In the document released yesterday, Lam requires the government to end with the new status to authorize the residence of newly graduates with high notes, but without any professional experience. From the perspective of the deputy, these permits of setting residence in Macao contradicts the policies presented by the government, and which were approved in the Legislative Assembly, which aimed to import qualified labor from abroad extremely successful professionally in their areas of activity. While hiring abroad, the deputy indicates that young licenses cross a very complicated phase of entry into the labor market, and that people from Macao who have graduated abroad also find a job market with many challenges, with difficulties to find a long -term job. In this context, the deputy asks the Executive whether the regime will eliminate the hiring of non-residents without professional experience. The reality of numbers Regarding the problem of unemployment among the younger ones, the deputy cites last year's official statistics to indicate that 47.1 percent of local unemployed were at least one degree. And among the unemployed with training in higher education, 28.1 percent was between 25 and 34 years old. "The numbers show that compared to 2019, the situation of unemployment is more serious. Many young people and middle-aged people who have academic education at higher education have told us that it is increasingly difficult to find a job and that companies only want non-resident workers," Ron Lam describes. The deputy also writes that the various employment fairs organized by the Directorate of Services for Laboral Affairs offer little attractive jobs, and that in many cases job vacancies are “false”, not leading to hiring. Lam also criticizes the way unemployment statistics are compiled, indicating that there are discrepancies between the different published data, which in theory should be similar. The deputy asks the government to correct this problem as soon as possible to be able to take employment measures according to the reality of the local market.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
item.description:
Graduated in the area of ​​educational technologies, Adelina Moura will conduct lectures to parents, students and teachers about the use of digital technologies in classrooms, within the “Letters & Company” festival of the Portuguese Institute of the East. The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005. The mobile phone can be an excellent learning tool, a means to motivate students and to enrich their learning. We have a kind of Swiss knife here, a very powerful equipment in the hands of the students and there is a school failure, because they do not work and help students enhance this equipment they have. What happens is that students learn in the worst way, in a destructed way, by attempt-rrove. There is a gap, as students are not alerted to the positive potential for mobile phone use. They face their mobile phones as a free time use, spending time on social networks and scrolling, and time consumes. It is essential that teachers are users, in their practices, mobile phones, and for the preparation of classes and other projects, to know how to prepare students. I consider that the school has lost several stages of students' preparation and awareness to use these equipment that lead to classes and with which schools have not spent any money. With the prohibition of bringing the mobile phone to the classroom we did not advance anything in this regard. During the pandemic period, for example, the use of technologies, with distance learning, was quite enhanced. But during the pandemic we also burned some steps regarding the use of digital by teachers, because before the pandemic many teachers did not believe or used. They thought it was a fashion and they saw no use in the use of mobile phones and other technologies. With the pandemic the use of these equipment proved that without them the situation of education would have been much worse. In these pandemic years, teachers have become more aware of the technologies that already exist and are available to anyone. With internet access on mobile phone, something that has existed since 2007 with the launch of the first iPhone, the e-learning system is enhanced and then we move to “Mobile Learning”, where you can learn anywhere and anytime with mobile devices. It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. But it is 30 years of technology where there have been many changes, and technology in fact goes on and if we immediately do not realize what we have available, we and students, we help create a moat that has happened in the past compared to digital. In the face of AI, if we do not look back and do not realize what was not done and should have been at school level, we are wasting time. Only a few years from now will people be alert to AI, and the gap is increasing. Hence it is very important to bet now, in this early stage, in the training of teachers, students and families. Is there much ignorance of parents, removal from this reality? We have parents who are from this century. That is, they were born with the existence of computers, internet, saw the appearance of the smartphone. But when they studied, the school did not talk about the potential of digital. So these former students came to society and did not bring this sensitivity to digital, to educate their children. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. The invitation I received from IPOR seems to me an excellent holistic view of everything, because the school includes several actors, connecting with society. How should AI be introduced into the classroom? We currently watch changes in search engines, in fact. We have search engines created from root to Age Age, for example. The best way to introduce AI into the classroom is to ask students and how they use it, and already resort to this tool. At the beginning of the academic year I always ask students to answer a questionnaire about their digital routines, and then I know more or less their practices. In 2023, when the chatgPT came out, I introduced AI in my classes, and realized that students were using this tool to deceive the teachers. Students have to realize that when using AI, they are falling into a certain trap because they are not learning. It is the law of the lowest effort, equal to the phase in which the internet emerged, when students selected, copied and sent to the teacher. We now have the problem that the answers are in Brazilian Portuguese, for example, and I see soon that AI was used. We have, therefore, to dismantle this action in the heads and face them. I tell them that they are being intellectually dishonest and that they have not read the AI ​​response, for example. Since 2023, I feel that students, in the answers to this questionnaire I do, say they are afraid to use chatgpt because they are afraid of being caught by teachers. That is, it seems to have gained some conscience. It will give these lectures in a different educational context in Asia, where the use of mobile phone can be earlier. How will you deal with these differences, or do you understand that the problems of using technology in the classroom are transversal? It is a transverse question. Do we have to wonder if the use of a particular equipment and tool will make us wiser? It seems to me not, because we may have the equipment, but the use we make it varies a lot. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. I tell them that with this technology they should all have a grade 20, and that they are wasting resources, being dishonest intellectually, because they sign works that are not theirs and do not read, even, they deliver. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children. It is this “parents school” that the school can help create. We are in a moment with no return of digital, and forbidding is the most comfortable situation, but it is not the best to face reality. We have to use the right words to alert. We have in this time of alerts and consciences, encouraging the critical spirit of our students, which is little today.
Teach Adelina Moura will teach a workshop for territory teachers on Saturday, with the session “Digital Literacy - Promotion of Positive Interactions”, aimed at teachers and agents of kindergarten, primary and secondary. The session takes place at the headquarters of IPOR, between 10am and 13h. On the same day, but in the afternoon, the session will be directed to parents and children. Degree in Portuguese and French Teaching, Master in Pedagogical Supervision of Portuguese Teaching and Doctorate in Education Sciences, in the Specialty of Educational Technology, Adelina Moura has been developing research in the area of ​​Mobile Learning, with several publications in Portugal and abroad. He is a teacher of Basic and Secondary Education, a tutor of distance learning courses at the Institute of Camões - Institute of Cooperation and Language and Training of Teacher Training, in specific didactics (Portuguese and French) and educational technology. On Wednesday, starting at 6:30 pm, Adelina Moura, Nuno Gomes and Min Yang will discuss “Artificial Intelligence in Education”.

item.title: We are! | Mozambican wins a photo contest on religions and beliefs
item.description:

item.title: Diaoyu Islands | Coast Guard expels Japanese fishing ship
item.description: The Chinese coast guard announced yesterday she had repelled a Japanese fishing ship that was in waters by the Diaoyu islands, known as Senkaku Islands in Japan, but claimed by China. Coast Guard spokesman Liu Dejun explained in a statement that the Japanese ship "entered illegally in the territorial waters of the Diaoyu islands on April 5 and 6" and that the Chinese coast guard ships "took the necessary control measures against him, according to the law," while "warned him to stay away." "The Chinese Coast Guard will continue to protect national sovereignty and maritime rights and interests," the spokesman warned in the official statement, adding that the islands "are inherent territory of China." The spokesman also asked Japan to “interrupt his illegal activities” in the area. In May 2024, China granted its coastal guard new capabilities, including the authority to stop foreign vessels suspected of illegally entering its territorial waters, in the midst of increasing territorial tensions with Japan and the Philippines. The Chinese Coast Guard has also seen its material operational capabilities from a material point of view, thanks to the sending of more vessels and the increase in logistics support. The dispute for the Diaoyu islands, won by Japan after the war with China in 1894-95, intensified after Japan nationalized three of them in September 2012. Located in the sea of ​​east China, about 150 kilometers northeast of Taiwan, which also claims sovereignty, the uninhabited Diaoyu islands cover an area of ​​about seven square kilometers and adjacent waters may contain significant gas and oil deposits.

According to the newspaper or Mun, the case happened on March 31, when a man was added by an unknown contact in the Wechat application. This contact was presented as a school principal, who needed to buy cleaning products for the institution. However, the alleged director told the elderly that he had argued with the supplier, so to have access to usual discounts needed the transaction to be made by someone else. Without distrusting anything, the man made the payment online, worth 78 thousand patacas. Historically, the old silk route divided into four periods: From the second century BC to the 6th century, having as high points the diffusion of the Buddhism and emergency of Islam; 2) From the beginning of the seventh century to the late tenth century, the highlight being the diffusion of porcelain; 3) From the eleventh century to the fifteenth century, with the heyday of the diffusion of Islamic and Hindu religions and tax trade in East Asia, the relics of the wreck and 7 trips of Admiral Zheng He (鄭和), between 1405-1431, as well as the emergence of multicultural communities such as Guangzhou, Malaca (Malásia) and Galle (Sri Lanka); 4) mid -century. This route started in the 15th and 16th centuries in Lisbon reached India, China and Japan, particularly Nagasaqui, and beyond, Timor, in a project that begins to be outlined by D. item.description: The Hold On To Hope Gallery, located in Ka-Hó and managed by the Macao Toxicode Pexicodes Rehabilitation Association, presents until the 27th of this month an exhibition in partnership with the group “Questionmark Workshop”, entitled “China's Academy of Arts-Exhibition of Research Class Instructors and Creation in Mineral Painting”. According to a statement from ArtM, this exhibition “aims to promote the traditional art form of painting with mineral pigments, bringing together eight influential teachers from China and Japan in this area”. There are “unique creations in the area of ​​rock color painting, demonstrating a perfect fusion of this ancestral technique with modern art,” he adds. Mineral pigments painting is also described as "an important expressive technique in traditional Chinese painting, it is known for its rich colors and unique methods." Thus, it shows "not only highlights the individual styles of artists, but also reflects their deep understanding and innovative exploitation of rock color techniques." The artm considers that “each work of the artists carries a single narrative and emotion, aiming to provoke the reassessment and contemplation of the public about the culture of rock color”. With this exhibition, the public will be able to “experience the charm of painting with mineral pigments, feeling the beauty of the art that fuses tradition with modernity”. You can also see works by Yiqiwava Yasumiqi, honorary teacher at Tama Art University, Japan; and vice president of Japan Art Academy. Another artist present is Yu LV Kui, graduated from the former Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts, currently China Academy of Arts, and former student at Tokyo Gakugei University in Japan. Zhang Lee, Wang Long, Li Han Ning, Sheng Xin Yi, Han Dian Liang are other artists who participate in this show with their art works.

item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position that the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several questions that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision made under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, came some ideas and opinions on “Bilateral Exchange and Cooperation in the Judicial, Economic-Commercial, Education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [tax identification number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, Chinese, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel
item.description:
During the visit to Macao of Portuguese Foreign Minister, Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to discuss the end of access to BIR access by Portuguese. The president of the House of Portugal in Macau associates this article with the position of Lisbon in the issue of 5G
It is another visit from a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Executive of Luís Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. After a journey through China, Paulo Rangel will meet with local associative leaders in order to perceive existing problems related to the Portuguese community. At HM, Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macau (CPM), argues that the difficulties of obtaining residence by Portuguese should be one of the pressing matters. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relationships for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything that is said in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in immigration in Macao, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this remoteness” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the Government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. It is a topic that may be addressed between the Portuguese State and the MSAR, so that there is greater flexibility to allow the Portuguese community to have greater accessibility to the right of residence, as existed before." For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, the MSAR has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to a greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still a community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this vision" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In the choice of correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December, an electronic voting pilot experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haimão, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Visit the EPM and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, MNE goes to Hong Kong to visit “Lusas Stories”, an exhibition dedicated to the Portuguese community at the Hong Kong History Museum. Lame

item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension to the elderly monthly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive the old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against the residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​Areia Preta. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer had loneliness problems, and could live with each other, and they can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, however, the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the subsidy we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would have benefited our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. A few years ago one of our associates has waited for more than three years for a reimbursement of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and Mark O'Neill, British author and journalist, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, has now done so with “Europeans in Hong Kong”, which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fueled by Europeans." The author explains that the most impressive story associated with the legacy of the French arises on the cover of the book. "In the nineteenth century, the French nuns adopted tens of thousands of Chinese girls who had been abandoned and gave them a good life. Without them, girls would have died or worked as child labor, maids or prostitutes," he said. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is today "familiar with the history of British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-term resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. "The Portuguese played a key role in the government, in banks, the liberal professions and the commercial companies. They lived here for many generations. Most of the expatriates were only the time of their mission; when they renovated, departed and returned to Britain or another country in Europe. book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MSAR as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows A Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the head of the chief executive, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, less than the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of the IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. “On Dongyu Island, Hainan Province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of state-of-the-art technology with sustainable development,” he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co.
