item.title: History | Lara Reis, Professor of Macao High School, remembered in Lisbon
item.description:
The former teacher of the Macao High School Fernando Lara Reis was remembered in the “Spring Conferences”, from the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center, by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira. A native of Leiria, Lara Reis fought in the 1st World War and lived on Avenida da República, in the villa that today houses the Macau Red Cross house
Fernando Lara Reis was born in 1892 and died in 1950. Throughout a life filled with historical events and testimonies, the natural man of Leiria was a military man and a teacher at Macao High School, eventually making the territory his home. Lara Reis's life was recently remembered in the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira, she herself old teacher in the territory. At the session, the historian, who won the 2024 Macao International Institute Identity Award (IIM), recalled the “teacher, meritorious, driving of the arts”, and owner of “unusual knowledge”. “He was a native of Leiria and lived in Macao until his death. He attended the Leiria High School, the Military College, then joined the Army School. In World War I was in Elvas, and then left to Angola in 1915 when he faced the German threat over Portuguese colonies in Africa. Observer-Aviator. ” Lara Reis was never a pilot as she wanted, having dedicated much of her life to teaching and Macao. “In 1919, Lara Reis went to Macao High School. He took a long circum-gap trip, leaving Portugal from Lisbon, going to the United States of America, crossed the entire territory and then went to Japan, going down to Hong Kong and even Macau. He was a teacher in Macao, drawing, handicrafts and gymnastics until the end of his life,” said Celina Veiga de Oliveira. The historian took to the session some written testimonies left by other Macao figures who wrote about Lara Reis, namely Monsignor Manuel Teixeira in the book “Macao Lyceu”. He said he never found "no teacher who had served the High School with greater dedication." “He was a rigorous methodical teacher, whose military formation was certainly not oblivious to these characteristics. What was truly standing out was his artistic vein, because Lara Reis was always concerned with ascertaining the aesthetic meaning of the students and opening their mental horizons. This at the time when Macau was a small town. that he organized and also exhibitions by Portuguese and foreign artists he sponsored, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira also highlighted the words left by the writer Henrique de Senna Fernandes in an interview on "one of the greatest qualities of Lara Reis", which "besides rigor and discipline, was the consideration by the students, not distinguishing rich from the poor." Professor Lara Reis was "a party prosecutor who served to obtain tuition fees for needy students," and "he is due to the initiative of the creation of the High School Association, of which he was the first president." This association organized in the former canhydrome “sports parties of the end of the year when students performed the most difficult exercises”. Work done in Macau The historian also highlighted “another aspect of dedication to territory” by Lara Reis. The Leiriense "participated in the 1st World War and this led him to interest all those who were incorporated into this conflict, having founded the League of the Great War fighters and had built in the cemetery of St. Miguel Archangel the monument where the bodies of combatants rest." Moreover, "another facet of his personality was a taste for travel, because he had no family and thus left for the world." "I visited museums, art schools and photographed everything I saw, having created a estate with 32 volumes that is now a heritage of Leiria." Celina Veiga de Oliveira did not forget the old “Sol Pente” villa, located in the middle-leaf zone, namely the Avenida da República, which was the house of Lara Reis, later donated to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao to “an anti-cancer clinic that was the first institution of the genre in the Portuguese colonial space”. Today this villa serves as a house to the Red Cross of Macao, and on its walls you can find a stone with the following message: “In this building legacy by the Rotary Fernando Reis to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao, it was installed at the initiative of the Rotary Club of Macao the first anti-cancer fighting center on April 15, 1951.” “Change of Ares” When Fernando Lara Reis goes to Macao, political times are troubled, with the political agitation to be lived in China after the fall of the Empire and the Republican Revolution of 1911. "In the 1920s the nationalist shock waves lived in the Canton, which sometimes haunted the Portuguese enclave quiet, but never moved with everyday life. The Portuguese administration guaranteed a standard appearance, and the parties at Christmas, Chinese New Year, the religious festivities of the Catholic community and the Chinese population were habitual." Celina Veiga de Oliveira recalled that in the late 1920s, Lara Reis decided to transfer to Goa, a trip that would only accentuate her belonging to Macau. “In the late 1920s, he felt he was time to change his air and asked to be transferred to the Afonso de Albuquerque High School in Pangim, and was there between 1941 and 1945, taking the opportunity to know India, and met the whole country. Instead, with a graceful and already sick license, choosing Macau to be his last address, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira recordou também as palavras de Orlando Cardoso, que no artigo “Macau e o Oriente na vida de Lara Reis” falou do homem que se deslumbrou com Macau “a partir do momento em que, às 8 horas da noite de 23 de Outubro de 1919, avistou pela primeira vez o Farol da Guia, um pouco antes de se instalar no ‘New Macao Hotel’ e sorver de sentidos atentos os sons, os cheiros e as luzes desta porta of an immeasurable and fantastic Asia that he would describe to exhaustion. ” These Lara Reis testimonies are “in a remarkable set of travel books that lay virtually unexplored in all their research potentialities on the shelves of the Leiria District Archive”, and were investigated by Orlando Cardoso himself. In the same article, this one refers to a text from the newspaper “News of Macau” of January 17, 1950, about Lara Kings: “The Auster and Worsen Teacher; the tenacious and thorough tourist; the military who fought and consecrated the memory of those who fell in the field of struggle; the honest and firm friend; the lovely and humorous companion; social celibate that, despite this, did not disdain any opportunity to undo its gallants, always kind and inconsequential to any palm with a face that in the goto ”. Given the few studies that exist about Lara Reis and the estate he left, Celina Veiga de Oliveira left a suggestion: "May the CCCM get the detailed index of the Leiria Archive, so that the research is possible for any interested researchers."

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a lawyer and auxiliary teacher at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring law, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this law proposal, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of reviewing this diploma has been “lengthy”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, and expressly defining criteria of aid and determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals submitted to competition, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: Employment | Criticized bet on leavers from outside without experience
item.description:
Deputy Ron Lam accuses the government from having diverted the political intention of allowing local companies to hire non-residents with international experience and success, and instead be issuing residence permitted to young people without curriculum.
Legislator Ron Lam attacked the government's policy of allowing imports as “talents” of non -residents with academic education, but without any professional experience. Criticism arises in a written interpellation, where the member of the Legislative Assembly indicates that politics is inconsistent, since one is through a phase in which the unemployment of newly educated is becoming worse and worse. In the document released yesterday, Lam requires the government to end with the new status to authorize the residence of newly graduates with high notes, but without any professional experience. From the perspective of the deputy, these permits of setting residence in Macao contradicts the policies presented by the government, and which were approved in the Legislative Assembly, which aimed to import qualified labor from abroad extremely successful professionally in their areas of activity. While hiring abroad, the deputy indicates that young licenses cross a very complicated phase of entry into the labor market, and that people from Macao who have graduated abroad also find a job market with many challenges, with difficulties to find a long -term job. In this context, the deputy asks the Executive whether the regime will eliminate the hiring of non-residents without professional experience. The reality of numbers Regarding the problem of unemployment among the younger ones, the deputy cites last year's official statistics to indicate that 47.1 percent of local unemployed were at least one degree. And among the unemployed with training in higher education, 28.1 percent was between 25 and 34 years old. "The numbers show that compared to 2019, the situation of unemployment is more serious. Many young people and middle-aged people who have academic education at higher education have told us that it is increasingly difficult to find a job and that companies only want non-resident workers," Ron Lam describes. The deputy also writes that the various employment fairs organized by the Directorate of Services for Laboral Affairs offer little attractive jobs, and that in many cases job vacancies are “false”, not leading to hiring. Lam also criticizes the way unemployment statistics are compiled, indicating that there are discrepancies between the different published data, which in theory should be similar. The deputy asks the government to correct this problem as soon as possible to be able to take employment measures according to the reality of the local market.

item.title: WONG KIT CHENG calls for response to increased youth crime
item.description: Deputy Wong Kit Cheng is concerned about youth crime and intends to know how the authorities will deal with the problem. The subject is addressed through written interpellation, in which the legislator linked to the General Association of Macao Women of Macau points out that last year the levels of crime among the youngest exceeded 2023, with great growth compared to 2019. Based on official numbers, the deputy indicates that last year 131 cases of juvenile delinquency were recorded, an increase of 23 cases compared to 2019, the last year before the pandemic, the data show an increase of 71 cases of juvenile delinquency last year. At the same time, the number of young people involved in crimes rose to 181, which represented an increase of 30 young people compared to 2023, when there were 151 young people detected in criminal activities. "The numbers reflect a continuous trend of increased youth crime in recent years, which is a cause for concern," warns Wong. "Young people are socially inexperienced and curious about new things, so they are easily enticed by unscrupulous people to get involved in illegal acts," he added. Parallel trade Among the activities that have enlisted the younger ones, Wong Kit Cheng indicated parallel trade, in which young people are used to illegally transport the interior, goods that are later resold. However, the deputy also recalled the cases of young people attracted to job offers to Taiwan and Cambodia, where they were involved in burlage schemes. "The community expects authorities to intensify the work of preventing and eliminating youth crime, which develop it in depth and in the light of the evolution of the social environment and the patterns of crime," was indicated. Women's deputies ask the political authorities to deal with the phenomenon and to have plans to ensure that young people have room to grow in a healthy environment, without being enticed to criminal activities. In addition, measures are also requested, not only to punish the younger ones, but also to ensure that they become integrated into society after the penalties are fulfilled.

item.title: IH / FIRE | Alarms that did not sound can originate sanctions
item.description:
The Housing Institute ensures that it is following the inspections following the fire in the Public Housing Complex Building the Lake, especially due to the alarms not played. The entity promises close communication with the administration of the building, but does not clarify whether irregularities were found
The Housing Institute (IH) received reports prepared by the Fire Department and the Lago Building Administration company about what happened in the fire that launched in the public housing complex on February 24. Two women were hospitalized and 18 people needed help to be removed from the building, although without injury. In the aftermath of the fire, residents complained that they did not hear the alarms sound. In addition, the firefighters confronted themselves with wrong information on the floor where the flames began. In response to a written interpellation of Deputy Lo Choi In, the IH states that “is following” the reports on the case, “as well as to proceed with investigation” and that, if irregularities are verified, “will establish the respective sanctioning procedure”. However, the response signed by the president of IH, iam Leng Leng, does not refer to whether management deficiencies were determined responsible for problems in fire equipment, merely suggesting that “regarding the building's property management, CB will continue to maintain narrow communication with IH and provide the necessary support with regard to fire prevention management”. Work Iam Leng Leng stresses that IH makes inspections and “oversees the administration of the common parts of economic housing and the operation of the facilities”, without mentioning whether it did so recently in the lake building. However, it states that it suggests "property management companies that send their workers to participate in lectures or raising and raising action on fire safety." Despite frequent occurrence of fire in housing buildings, authorities ensure that the CB discloses information on fire safety, through lectures, fire and disaster prevention actions, evacuation exercises, visits to residents and organizations, and distribution of pamphlets. "Between 2024 and February 2025, the CB developed more than 520 fire prevention raising actions in buildings and distributed about 8,000 pamphlets and posters with fire prevention information."

item.title: Security | Deputy calls for disabled of unnamed elevators
item.description: Yesterday the transition period ended to owners and condominium administrations to proceed with the annual inspection of the elevators. According to the Legal Safety Regime of the Lifts, approved three years ago, elevators who have not passed the inspection must suspend operation. Speaking to the Citizen Journal, Deputy Wu Chou Kit argued that the government must be strict and demand the suspension of elevators who were not submitted to security inspections. Regarding the cost of elevator inspection, Wu Chou Kit considers that the prices charged in Macau are reasonable and generally lower than the government's charging criteria. Recently, Deputy Leong Sun Iok revealed that he received complaints from residents about the lack of transparency in pricing from elevator inspector entities. In addition, the workers' deputy indicated that sometimes residents or condominium administrations are required to wait a long time to get a budget.

item.title: Bullshit polls
item.description: What is a poll? It is an inquiry carried out by companies created to inquire with people something that is intended to have a widespread idea. Well, widespread is never possible. Because most political polls are a bullshit. There are the most varied types of polls: commissioned by political parties, television channels and radio, newspapers and some simply by economic groups. Political polls in Portugal have been a crushing crush on the end result of elections. There was a year, where all the polls held with the respondents gave victory to the Socialist Party and who won the elections was the PSD. And the opposite has already happened. The polls that have been released lately, in relation to the next early legislative elections and marked on May 18, have left the majority of the disoriented population. And why? Now, because the polls are a bullshit. Some polls have been carried out - in a population of millions of people - along with 500, 800 or 1000 people, with the aggravation of contacts to be made for fixed phones numbers. And who has a landline today? A few old men and a little more. Now, a poll of this genre, incredibly commissioned by a television station, another radio and a daily newspaper, has any credibility? It does not have, but influences the electorate potential. And here is the Busis of the question. There are polls that only aim at the mental influence of voters. There are polls for all tastes. It is even shameful. Certain polls we know that they are paid to birth for a certain political party and always present this party ahead. It is total manipulation. item.title: Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (I)
item.description: On February 21, 2024, the Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (HKIAAC) (Hong Kong International Academy against Corruption) was created. Hu Yingming, director of Hong Kong’s Independent Commission Against Corruption (HKICAC) (Independent Hong Kong Commission against corruption) noted in an interview that HKICAC and HKIAAC are institutions that can provide good reports from China and Hong Kong. HKICAC is a Hong Kong government department that fights corruption through law forces and preventive and pedagogical strategies, making Hong Kong one of the freer corruption places in the world. HKICAC has four departments, one of which is the “International Cooperation and Institutional Affairs Department”. HKIAAC is affiliated with the International Department of Institutional Affairs and Cooperation. Why did Kong create HKICAC? The Academy website explains the reason: "Corruption was rampant in the public sector. Ambulance teams demanded tips before getting a patient. Even the hospital's auxiliary staff asked for patients before giving patients some food or a glass of water. It was also necessary to offer bribes to the right employees when someone applied for housing, education and other public services. Corruption was particularly severe in police forces." The website also points out that what triggered the creation of HKICAC was the incident with Peter Godber: “In 1973, it was found that Peter Godber, Hong Kong police superintendent, had a $ 4.3 million fortune from Hong Kong, who was suspected to have been obtained through bribes. The secretary of justice asked Godber to prove the origin of his fortune within a week. United. Godber's escape exploded the indignation that the public had long been accumulating. ” At that time, the requirements for “fighting corruption and catching Godber” were heard everywhere. HKICAC was created on February 15, 1974. It fulfilled its mission and got Peter Godber to attend the court. There are many Hong Kong films that are based on this and also show patients to give tips to hospital assistants in order to have some boiled water or a drag. Although the contents of the films are exaggerated and intended for entertainment, they reveal the dimension of corruption in Hong Kong's society at that time. Following the Peter Godber incident, HKICAC investigated many famous business cases, such as Carrian Group's commercial fraud, the case of the high -end of the Warwick Reid Justice Department, the case of senior police officer Xian Jinhua, the case of artist Nicholas TSE, the bribe from the famous Chinese language teacher Xiao Yuan, etc. Among the subjects investigated we can find government officials, celebrities, senior business group executives, artists, teachers, etc. In solving these cases, HKICAC has gained society's recognition and compliments and managed to make Hong Kong one of the freer corruption places in the world. Hong Kong Basic Law Comtemplas HKICAC maintenance. Article 57 stipulates that HKICAC operates independently and is directly responsible to the chief executive, ie reports John Lee, head of the region's government. Article 101 of the Hong Kong Basic Law stipulates that the head of the independent committee against corruption must be a permanent resident Chinese citizen in Hong Kong and cannot have residence in any foreign country. item.title: Lusophone exports to China fall more than 30% until February
item.description: Exports from Portuguese -speaking countries to China fell 30.7 percent in the first two months of 2025, compared to the same period last year. According to information from China's customs services, in January and February the Lusophone Block sold goods of $ 17 billion to the Chinese market. According to the data, gathered by the Forum for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries (Macao Forum), this is the lowest value for the first two months of a year since 2021, in the middle of COVID - 19 pandemic. The descent was due mainly to the largest Lusophone supplier in the Chinese market, Brazil, whose sales fell one third (33.4 percent) to $ 13.7 billion. In addition, also the second largest Chinese commercial partner in the Lusophone block, Angola, saw exports decrease 16.4 percent to $ 2.37 billion. Also the sales of goods from Portugal to China decreased by 13 percent to $ 444.4 million. On the contrary, the exports of Mozambique rose more than one third (34.4 percent) to $ 332.2 million. Equatorial Guinea exports to the Chinese market dropped 71.2 percent to $ 85.6 million, while Timor-Leste sales shred 98 percent. The exports of Sao Tome and Principe also fell 53.3 percent, although the country did not sell more than 1,000 dollars in goods. Already Cape Verde and Guinea-Bissau did not sell any merchandise to China in the first two months of 2025. On the other hand In the opposite direction, Chinese exports to Portuguese -speaking countries also reduced 9 percent to $ 12.2 billion. The data reveal that Brazil was the largest buyer in the Lusophone block, with imports from China to reach $ 10.3 billion, a drop of 7.8 percent in annual terms. Second on the list comes Portugal, which bought the goods of $ 932.4 million, less than 10.5 percent than in the same period as 2024. China registered a commercial deficit of $ 4.78 billion with the Lusophone Block in the first two months of 2025. In all, trade between Portuguese -speaking countries and China reached $ 29.2 billion, less 23.1 percent than in the same period last year.

The first long -haul load route between Macau and Madrid is being operated by Ethiopia's Ethiopian Airlines company. The company's director for China argues that Macau is “an important platform” for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries
The first long-haul load route between Macao and Madrid tore off on Thursday with a Boeing 777F operated by Ethiopian Airlines, which raised flight from Macao International Airport (MIA). The Ethiopian airline will make two round -trip trips per week, and the 777F Boeing will mainly transport transfronic electronic trade goods, according to a note from the Mia Management company, to which Lusa had access. "The new route will further improve the air load network between Asia and Europe, providing more efficient logistical support for exports in the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau (GBA) area, and boosting logistical competitiveness." According to Mia Manager, Madrid is one of Europe's leading logistics centers, so "the opening of this new route will satisfy the growing demand for air load, while reinforcing connectivity between GBA and European markets," the load volumes are expected to be "increasing". Ethiopian Airlines' national director for China, Aman Wole Gurmu, cited in the note, said Macau is “an important platform” for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, so the launch of the new route will reinforce this role, constituting an air logistics corridor that will connect Europe and Asia. Fill in gaps "This new route not only fills the gap in cargo transportation between Macau and Spain, but also takes advantage of the local network in Spain to connect Macau to the markets in Africa and South America, forming a triangular logistics network" Asia-Africa-Europe "," according to Aman Wole Gurmu, although the chased network seems to be "quadrangular", given the inclusion of the American continent. "This will help Macao become a key center for transfronight exports of electronic trade and cargo transportation in the large bay area," he added. According to the Mia Management company, there is a constant growth in the cargo business in recent years, looking for air logistics to be driven by the rapid increase in transionic electronic trade, with Macau Airport involved in a load transport in the order of 108,000 tons in 2024.

item.title: Game / Recipes | JP Morgan and Seport Partners with different views
item.description:
Revenues of 19.66 billion Patacas in March were within the expectations of the market, but corrector Seport Research Partners warns that recent campaigns against illegal money exchanges can make the volume of bets fall
“It was not bad at all,” this is how the most recent report of the investment bank JP Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) ranked the raw revenues of the March game, which reached 19.66 billion Patacas. The investment bank's reaction was cited on Wednesday by the GGR Asia portal. Revenues this March represented an increase of 0.8 percent compared to the same period, but a 0.4 percent reduction compared to February. However, the report signed by DS Kim, Selina Li and Shi Mufan, points out that the total amount was "one percent above the estimates of JP Morgan [and the market] and the consensus [among analysts] that predicted no growth." The document also indicates that the daily average of revenues in the casinos was 634 million patacas, which was pointed as a volume of daily revenues similar to the months of January and February this year. Therefore, analysts pointed out that revenues in March reached “very respectable” values. In the same vein, JP Morgan considered that market signals are encouraging for the second half of the year. "This is a good omen for growth to improve in the second half of 2025." “We maintain our forecast of game growth growth by 2025 of 3 percent, with the first semester to show a growth of 0 to 1 percent, and the second semester with a growth between 5 and 6 percent,” he was added. Below expectations In turn, the corrector Seport Research Partners had a different reaction from revenues, quoted by the GGR Asia portal, as it had predicted greater growth than the recorded. According to yesterday's report, signed by Vitaly Umansky, the revenues "were weaker than the predictions made earlier this month, but which still did not fail to slightly exceed Bloomberg estimates, which indicated that there would be no growth." On the other hand, Seport Research Partners indicates that the revenues of late March still reflect the possible impact of the authorities' campaign against two illegal money exchange groups acting on casinos, and involving at least 43 people. Therefore, in April Seport Research Partners expects revenues to have a 0.1 percent reduction compared to the same period and 5.8 percent compared to May. "Our estimate for April is slightly affected by the potential short -term adverse effects linked to the repression of [illegal] chamberways," was justified.

item.title: Earthquake | Number of dead in Myanmar increases to 3,471
item.description: The death toll of March 28 in Myanmar increased to 3,471, with more than 4,600 injured and 214 missing, yesterday the military junta in power in the country. The Armed Forces released this new balance through Myanmar's Global New Light newspaper, at a time when rescue teams, including some foreigners, continue to remove rubble and look for missing. The previous balance, released on Saturday, pointed to 3,354 dead, 4,850 injured and 220 missing, having been rescued by 653 people. The 7.7 magnitude earthquake has reached a large area of ​​the country, causing significant damage to six regions and states, including the capital Nayphitaw, leaving many areas without energy and communications. The shake also aggravated the humanitarian crisis triggered by the country's civil war, which internally moved more than three million people, according to the United Nations. Military Government leader General Min Aung Hlaing said that the earthquake was the second strongest in the country's history after the magnitude 8 earthquake of Mandalay in May 1912. Global Aids The regime also explained that more than 150 tons of humanitarian aid - from countries such as China, the United States, Singapore, India and Thailand - entered the country since the earthquake. An estimate mentions collapse or partial damage in at least 21,783 houses, 805 office buildings, 1,690 pagodas, 1,041 schools, 921 monasteries and convents, 312 religious buildings, 48 ​​hospitals and 18 hectares of plantations. Min Aung Hlaing, confirmed - in another article published yesterday by the official newspaper - the plan to build temporary schools to ensure that children return to class as soon as possible. The Armed Forces returned yesterday to accuse the ethnic guerrillas and the democratic opposition to commit “terrorist acts”, referring to alleged attacks on state and military facilities, in the midst of territorial dispute that has worsened since the coup d'état of February 2021. The military and various armed resistance groups declared a temporary ceasefire on Wednesday, after the earthquake, to facilitate the flow of humanitarian aid. On Wednesday, the United Nations Office for Human Rights accused the Military Board of not respecting the ceasefire, having made at least 16 attacks since the truce and a total of 61 since the earthquake. On March 28, a 7.7 magnitude earthquake on the Richter scale, with epicenter in Myanmar (former Burma) was felt in several Southeast Asia countries, including Thailand, where a total of 22 people died in the capital.

item.title: Diaoyu Islands | Coast Guard expels Japanese fishing ship
item.description: The Chinese coast guard announced yesterday she had repelled a Japanese fishing ship that was in waters by the Diaoyu islands, known as Senkaku Islands in Japan, but claimed by China. Coast Guard spokesman Liu Dejun explained in a statement that the Japanese ship "entered illegally in the territorial waters of the Diaoyu islands on April 5 and 6" and that the Chinese coast guard ships "took the necessary control measures against him, according to the law," while "warned him to stay away." "The Chinese Coast Guard will continue to protect national sovereignty and maritime rights and interests," the spokesman warned in the official statement, adding that the islands "are inherent territory of China." The spokesman also asked Japan to “interrupt his illegal activities” in the area. In May 2024, China granted its coastal guard new capabilities, including the authority to stop foreign vessels suspected of illegally entering its territorial waters, in the midst of increasing territorial tensions with Japan and the Philippines. The Chinese Coast Guard has also seen its material operational capabilities from a material point of view, thanks to the sending of more vessels and the increase in logistics support. The dispute for the Diaoyu islands, won by Japan after the war with China in 1894-95, intensified after Japan nationalized three of them in September 2012. Located in the sea of ​​east China, about 150 kilometers northeast of Taiwan, which also claims sovereignty, the uninhabited Diaoyu islands cover an area of ​​about seven square kilometers and adjacent waters may contain significant gas and oil deposits.

item.title: Locked agreement for sale of Tiktok in the USA after Trump impotes tariffs
item.description: China's government has blocked an agreement to sell US investors from Tiktok, a platform controlled by the Chinese Bytedance, after the imposition of tariffs by the United States, a source said. The source, which asked not to be identified, told the Associated Press (AP) news agency that the US presidency believed the parties were close to an agreement. The agreement provided that Tiktok's operations in the US were separated in a new company, held in the country, detained and operated by a majority of US investors, with Bytedance to maintain a minority position. Optimism around the agreement will have led US President Donald Trump to say Friday that he would maintain an operational Tiktok in the country for another 75 days, the day before expiring the deadline for selling the platform. “My government has been working hard to save Tiktok, and we made a tremendous progress,” Trump, who said the business was imminent on Thursday. "We look forward to working with Tiktok and China to close the deal," said the US president. But Beijing fought the deal on Thursday, a day after Trump announced comprehensive tariffs around the world, including an additional 34 percent rate on China's imports. For resolve Bytedance representatives called the White House to indicate that China would not approve the agreement until there were trade and tariff negotiations, the source told AP. The agreement was built over months, with the team of Vice President JD Vance to negotiate directly with various potential investors and bytedance employees. The plan provided for a period of 120 days to complete regulatory procedures and financing. The agreement was approved by existing investors, new investors, bytedance and the US government. A bytedance spokesman confirmed in a statement that the company has been discussing a "potential solution" with the US government, but stressed that an "agreement was not implemented." "There are important questions to resolve," said the spokesman. "Any agreement will be subject to approval under the Chinese law," he added. Bytedance launched the Douyin application in 2016, and after its success in China, created in 2017 a global version, Tiktok, growing faster than Facebook and Instagram rivals.

item.title: WTO | China files a complaint about US tariffs
item.description:
Beijing vehemently disputes Trump's rates to his exports, accusing the US of violating the basic rules of the World Trade Organization
China announced Friday that it sent to the World Trade Organization (WTO) the issue of the tariffs imposed by the United States to its exports, having filed a complaint in the dispute resolution mechanism. "China filed a complaint in the WTO dispute resolution mechanism," said the Beijing Ministry of Commerce, in a statement quoted by AFP. China also announced Friday the imposition of a 34 percent rate on imports of all US products from April 10, in response to the new tariffs imposed by the US. "The imposition by the United States of so -called 'reciprocal tariffs' severely violates WTO rules, severely impairs the legitimate rights and interests of WTO members and severely undermines the rules -based multilateral trade system and international economic and commercial order," the Ministry of Commerce said. "It is a typical practice of unilateral intimidation that endanger the stability of the global economic and commercial order. China is firmly opposed to this," he added. China's measures come after US President Donald Trump, on Wednesday, imposed a new 34 percent rate on Chinese products, part of what Washington calls “reciprocal” tariffs over countries around the world. In the case of Beijing, these rates are additional to 20 percent rates already in force, which causes Chinese imports to be subject to a rate of at least 54 percent. Attacked Asia The Chinese Ministry of Commerce expressed its "firm opposition" on Thursday and promised to retaliate to "safeguard" the rights and interests of the Asian country. In early March, China announced 10 percent and 15 percent rates on US agricultural products in response to 20 percent tariffs that Trump imposed on Chinese products. During his first presidency (2017-2021), Trump had already had a tense relationship with Beijing as he imposed several rounds of about $ 370 billion annually, to which China responded with rates on US exports. The US president also imposed high rates on Wednesday on the countries for which Chinese factories moved after the first commercial conflict, including Vietname (46 percent), Cambodia (49 percent) and Laos (48 percent), blocking the exit of Chinese products.

item.title: Earthquake | Myanmar Military Junta declares ceasefire in the civil war until April 22 to facilitate help
item.description: The Military Junta in Power in Myanmar declared a ceasefire in the civil war today until April 22, to facilitate help to the population, after the 7.7 magnitude earthquake that hit the country on March 28. The temporary ceasefire was also decreed to show compassion for affected people, today said the state television of Myanmar (former Burma). The announcement, made in a statement from the Military High Command, is followed by unilateral temporary ceasefogs declared by armed resistance groups that oppose the military regime. Television news indicated that ethnic armed groups and local militias should refrain from attacking state security forces and military bases, and should not organize, gather strength or expand their areas of influence. If such groups do not comply with these conditions, the army will take the necessary measures, according to the statement. A new balance today released by the authorities raised to 2,886 the number of dead and 4,639 the number of wounded in the earthquake of five days, while continuing survivor search operations. According to the democratic opposition, which controls parts of the country, about 8.5 million people were “directly affected” by the earthquake in the country at war. item.title: Myanmar | More than 2,880 dead and 4,600 injured
item.description: The Burmese military junta yesterday raised the balance of the earthquake that hit Myanmar five days ago to 2,886 dead and 4,639 injured, while searching for survivors. The previous balance, released on Tuesday, was 2,719 dead, 4,521 injured and 441 missing. The table spokesman, General Zaw Min Tun, released the new provisional balance to the EFE news agency, at a time when there was another rescue of a survivor. Five days after the earthquake, a 20 -year -old was rescued by Burmese and Turkish rescuers from a hotel in the capital, Naypyidaw, authorities said. The board said about 1,500 rescuers from 15 countries are in the country of Southeast Asia affected by an earthquake of magnitude 7.7 on Friday, March 28, which also hit neighboring Thailand. Rescuers come from China, India, Russia, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysian, United Arab Emirates, Laos, Belarus, Turkey, Bhutan, Philippines, Bangladesh and Indonesia. The military junta, which took power after a coup d'état in February 2021, said foreign teams also took medications and other materials that were being delivered in some regions. However, international aid has not yet reached all affected areas, the authorities admitted. Over the weekend, the board stated that more than 2,600 buildings, including houses, churches, schools and pagodas, broke due to earthquake and replicas. The United Nations Humanitarian Coordination Office (OCHA) stated that only in Naypyidaw more than 10,000 buildings were destroyed or severely damaged. War Zones The democratic opposition, which controls parts of the country, estimated that 8.5 million people were “directly affected” by the earthquake in a country that is at war, which aggravates the situation and makes humanitarian efforts difficult. The military said yesterday that they fired shots to the air to try to push elements from China's Red Cross in a conflict zone with the rebels. Spokesman Zaw Min Tun stated in a statement that soldiers tried to stop a train of nine vehicles heading to the village of Ommati, in the state of Shan (north), on Tuesday night. "The security forces tried to stop the vehicles when they saw them, but failed," he said, quoted by the France-Presse (AFP) news agency. Zaw Min Tun stated that the board was investigating the incident. According to the spokesman, no “prior notification” was made about the entry of Chinese rescuers “to Myanmar either to their embassy, ​​nor to the Military Attachment Office” in Beijing, a previous condition for foreign aid entry. The Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TLNA), one of the leading rebel ethnic groups, clashed in Ommati, the spokesman said, claiming that "certain groups were taking political part of the aid. Asked about the incident, China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said the equipment sent by the Chinese Red Cross had arrived and was safe, such as humanitarian workers. "We ask all parts of Myanmar to allow passage without hindrances of help," added the ministry, quoted by AFP. China sent a team of 82 humanitarian workers to Myanmar on Saturday and 118 more on Sunday. The head of the Military Junta, Min Aung Hlaing, called for the help of the international community, a rare action of the Burmese military and illustrating the size of the catastrophe.

item.title: Hong Kong | Replaced police chief Raymond Siu Chak-Yee
item.description: The Hong Kong government announced yesterday the replacement of police chief Raymond Siu Chak-Yee. Hong Kong Chief Executive, John Lee Ka-Chiu, said in a statement that Raymond Siu "entered a pre-reform license today after serving the Hong Kong police body for 36 years." The commissioner "has demonstrated an unobailable dedication and determination to protect Hong Kong and defend the right to dealing with social agitation," said John Lee, in reference to the huge, sometimes violent old manifestations of 2019. The announcement comes two days after the United States has imposed sanctions on the police chief and five public leaders of Hong Kong, including the secretary for justice, Paul Lam Ting-Kwok, under American law defending democracy in the Chinese region. On Tuesday, Hong Kong condemned the imposition of sanctions and accused Washington of trying to “intimidate leaders in charge of protecting China's national security”. "This clearly exposed US barbarism (…) exactly the same as recent intimidation and coercion tactics from various countries and regions," said the government of the Special Administrative Chinese. Hong Kong authorities also indicated that the Chinese central government approved the appointment of Joe Chow Yat-Min, so far Deputy Commissioner, to lead the territory police. John Lee pointed out that 52 -year -old Joe Chow has "a vast experience in criminal investigation, information gathering, policy formulation, as well as personnel management." According to the Hong Kong press yesterday, at the first conference as a new commissioner, Chow pointed to national security as the priority, given what he called "hidden currents" of resistance to the current regime. The leader criticized sanctions against Raymond Siu as an act of intimidation and argued to be a reflection of the success of Hong Kong police efforts to capture fugitives to justice.

item.title: Bangkok | China urges companies to respect laws after falling tower
item.description: The China Embassy in Thailand has called for Chinese companies in the country to “respect local laws”, after a investigation into the collapse of a Bang of Bang of Bang of Apartments, which killed about 10 people. Beijing “constantly urges Chinese companies abroad to respect local laws and contribute positively to society,” said the chancel yesterday on his Facebook page. The construction of the tower, located near the popular Chatuchak market in northern Bangcoque, involved a branch of Chinese state company Railway Group (CREC) and its local partner Italian-Thai Development (ITD). The tremors reduced the structure to a pile of rubble in a matter of seconds, causing the death of about ten people, with ever smaller hopes for more than 70 people who are still cornered in the rubble. Most victims were workers of Burmese, Laoconiana, Cambodian and Thai nationality. The 30 -story building aimed to host government offices. "We have to determine where the error occurred," said Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who on Monday ordered an investigation into the materials and safety standards on site by a group of experts that should present a report this week. Beijing sent a team to Bangkok, including rescue teams, and promised to "continue supporting Thailand if necessary." China is the largest source of direct foreign investment in Thailand, with $ 2 billion injected into the kingdom by 2024, according to the Open Development Thailand data supplier. Paetongtarn Shinawatra announced on Tuesday that the investigation will not be "specific to a country." "We don't want any particular country to think we're just looking at them," he said.

item.title: Taiwan | Beijing condemns criticism of the maneuvers around the island
item.description: The Chinese government yesterday criticized “a minority of countries” of interference in China's internal affairs, after some nations condemned the Chinese army maneuvers around Taiwan. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun said at a press conference that "Taiwan's issue is a purely internal issue in China and does not admit foreign interference." Guo stated that "what undermines peace and stability in Taiwan's narrow is the" separatist "activities in favor of Taiwan's independence and the connivance and support of external forces." "If you really want peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait, they have to follow the general trend of the international community," added the spokesman, appealing to "respect for sovereignty and territorial integrity of China." Guo said that "defending Taiwan's independence is to divide the country, supporting it is to interfere with China's internal affairs and to approve it is to undermine the stability in Taiwan's narrow" and stressed that the maneuvers of Chinese forces constitute "a resolute disciplinary action against the provocations" led by Taiwan leader, William Lai, for the "unbridled attempts of independence." "While the provocations in favor of Taiwan's independence continues, the punishment against 'independentists' will not cease," the spokesman warned, claiming that Beijing "will never allow someone or any force to separate Taiwan from China by any means." On Tuesday, Washington condemned Chinese maneuvers around Taiwan and assured that US President Donald Trump insists on the importance of "maintaining peace" in the narrow. For its part, the European Union's external action service has lamented that Chinese maneuvers “increase tensions in the Taiwan Strait.” Continued The Chinese army announced yesterday morning the new military exercises in downtown and southern Taiwan's Strait to “test troop skills,” following Tuesday's maneuvers. The exercises, called “Thunder-2025a Straits”, focused on “identification and verification”, “warning and expulsion” and “interception and detention” tasks to “test troop skills” in domains such as “air control, blockage, and accuracy attacks on key targets”. Experts cited in the Chinese official press have stated that the exercises show that the Chinese military has “broad deterioration options” and that Beijing has chosen to “tighten the siege of the secessionist forces” with “harder measures and energetic actions”. The exercises are taking place weeks after William Lai, considered “pro-independence and disorderly” by the Chinese authorities, dubbed China as “hostile external force” and announced initiatives to lock Beijing's “infiltration” operations on the island.

item.title: João Romão, academic: “Macau is in a highly privileged position”
item.description:
Professor at Yasuda Women’s University in Japan, João Romão prepares to launch in June a book entitled “Economic Geography of Tourism”. Speaking to HM, the academic enhances the interconnection between tourism, economy and geography, and lists its possibilities, limitations and effects, including Macao
In this book it speaks of the concept of “spatial economy”, in connection with tourism and geography. How is this connection? Economic geography combines the geographical context with economic processes, being studied the spatial distribution of economic activities. The economy of tourism is particularly sensitive to these geographical constraints, as they are the characteristics of each place that enhances the development of certain products or services. These characteristics widely exceed the physical aspects of the territory and also include culture, history, ways of life or even institutions and legal frameworks. The case of casino, something particularly important in Macao, is a good example of the importance of legal aspects to develop certain types of tourism. Economic geography has a wider scope than the spatial economy, more focused on strictly economic aspects. Being evident in tourism this relationship between economics and geography, this book establishes a double approach that systematizes the interdependence of these three aspects it refers. First explores how the concepts and theories of economic geography can apply to tourism. In the second half it makes the opposite route, discussing how the analysis of relevant problems of contemporary tourism justifies the use of economic geography. Examples are the degradation of local resources, environmental impacts, contribution to climate change, acceleration of gentrification processes or disturbance of community modes of life. Can having an excessively -dependent economy of tourism constitute a problem or salvation? The two things, and are both cases that economic geography can help to understand. The industrialization of economies is linked to the agglomeration processes of activities that reinforce each other when they reach a certain scale. This allows the massification of production and consumption, with reasonable costs. Contemporary industries, more associated with the integration of digital technologies and creative processes, are less clustered in specialized industrial development zones, but tend to focus on large cities and metropolitan areas. It also follows that rural areas, islands, or sites that have not followed industrialization processes, have more difficulty mobilizing investments, technologies or qualified people to innovate and develop new industries. In such cases, tourism often appears as the possible solution as it can be developed with incorporation of technology and relatively low knowledge. On the other hand, tourism consumption, not being essential to human life, is very sensitive to income fluctuations. Can you give examples? This was visible, for example, with the 2007/2009 international crisis. Tourism is also very vulnerable to safety problems or international epidemics, such as COVID-19 has demonstrated to the extreme. Economies too specialized in tourism are very vulnerable to external shocks and less resilient to crises. It is also visible that, being the tourist development often supported by intensive and weak labor services, the specialization in tourism can cause, in the long run, embarrassment in terms of population qualifications, the ability to innovate and integrate technology or to add value to the regional economy. The book also speaks of “intelligent tourism” and “co-creation of experiences”, using the megados and IA. Is tourism definitely becoming more digital? Social networks are fundamental instruments for new generations. However, they began to generalize the tools for planning or promotion of travel supported by artificial intelligence. The so-called “intelligent tourism” more generally designates the use of digital technologies to intensify information flows, consolidate the formation of networks and promote more informed and shared decision making, eventually contributing to the so-called “co-creation of experiences”. Tourism digitization has its origins in service distribution systems originally developed by airlines since the 1960s, but it would be the internet to accelerate and globalize digitization. And social networks. The emergence of social networks promoted the creation of a more interactive universe, potentially in real time and involving wide numbers of users and various types of supports. The generalization of the use of mobile phones permanently connected to the Internet, even on foreign travel, has further increased this potential for intensive and interactive use of data and information. This "co-creation", however, hides obvious imbalances of power. Such as? With regard to tourists, or consumer in general, it is usually the role of providing information, for example through social networks. This information is obtained, accumulated and marketed, sometimes without consent or even without knowledge, to eventually translate into the creation, adaptation or promotion of products and services. This process is particularly important in the case of tourism, because there is usually a long period between the decision to travel and the trip itself. This period of travel exploration and planning is used by tourist marketing companies to try to influence choices. This type of interaction also introduces a difference in the “spatiality” of the provision of tourist services, which are usually produced and consumed at the same time and in the same place, in a direct relationship between producer and consumer. The digitization of tourism anticipates most of these interactions and information flows and transfers them to large technological companies or marketing and distribution. In a world where more and more travel, the routes are shorter and access to information is immense, how can countries and regions be competitive in the tourist offer? Contemporary tourism lives in a highly competitive international environment. But just as there is a wide variety of destinations and offerings, there is also a wide range of preferences and consumption, what is called “hyper-personalization”, the result of such abundance of information and opportunity for interaction. The challenge that is placed on destinations is to identify the resources, products and services that can be adjusted to a particular group of consumers, to communicate effectively. This competitiveness greatly goes beyond the strict scope of tourist services because it also requires mobility and transportation services, varied infrastructure, safety, medical support, or easy communication. Anywhere you want to develop your tourist industry have to intervene about all these factors. The book also addresses how “social processes” shape the development of tourism. In the case of China, for example, do you believe we are watching a change, which will have consequences for Macau? It seems to me that Macau is in a highly privileged position to develop other forms of tourism. China is the largest issuing market in the world, the widespread rise of income in recent decades allows many million people to explore the opportunity to travel. Macao is a very close and distinct destination, with its historical and cultural particularities. For the Chinese population it was not easy to visit Macau and there is certainly a great interest. How does the Great Bay project come in this? The strategy that is being followed by integrating the Great Bay allows you to develop a cosmopolitan and diverse offer that can certainly attract Chinese tourists and other parts of the world. Moreover, these three areas have excellent hotel and tourism schools, which guarantee qualified personnel for tourism management and planning. The element of differentiation that Portuguese culture introduces in this context can certainly contribute to the success of the transition from a casinos focused on other forms that value culture and heritage more. Is it possible to have sustainable tourism? The problems and difficulties of tourism sustainability are more visible than in other sectors. This “spatiality” of tourism (where the consumer is obliged to move to the place of consumption) implies that the consequences of this consumption become more evident. These effects are less obvious when it comes to the unsustainability of industrial units or intensive forms of agriculture in relatively isolated areas. As mass reduction and investment reduction strategies also apply to tourism, the consequences of the environment or the quality of life of residents in destinations can be devastating. Sustainability implies a long -term perspective based on the idea that today's decisions do not imply future negative consequences. Sustainable practices depend on the control of the impacts that accumulate over time by individual and independent economic agents. How can this control be done? When a hotel or airline defines what ability to install on their services they may eventually estimate the impact that consumers will have on the local environment or economy. They will have more difficulties in anticipating that impacts will be generated in the next 10, 15 or 20 years to investment. And surely it will be impossible to measure how this impact accumulates the impacts caused by other service providers, now or in the future. In other words, although the idea of ​​sustainability is widespread accepted, economic agents do not have mechanisms or instruments in practice. Regulating the use of resources and territories by public entities with a more comprehensive and future perspective can contribute to the sustainability more effectively than the regulation associated with market dynamics, which in many cases has been revealed highly predatory. The Chinese economy is one of these examples and may eventually benefit from it. And in the concrete case of Macau? Macao has historically known problems: ultra-urbanized and polluted areas, with large energy consumption and waste production; Great concentration of tourists in a relatively small area of ​​great historical and cultural interest; Great dependence on the game, with the resulting imbalances in the appropriation of tourism benefits. The ongoing transition to new forms of tourism should better solve these problems and state regulation will certainly have better results than based on market dynamics.

item.title: José Paulo Esperança, Associate Rector of the City of Macau University: “Languages ​​cannot be controlled”
item.description:
Co-author of the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, with Luís Reto and Fernando Luís Machado, José Paulo Esperança reveals to HM that the work edited in 2016 and 2018 is being updated, especially due to the growing global value of the language. The Associate Rector and Professor of the City of Macao University suggests partnerships with Macau under the Editorial Project
Launched the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, in co-authorship, about the global value of the language. Plan a new edition or update? Undoubtedly. We are working in this regard, there was a recent conference in Macao and Professor Luís Reto, former Rector of ISCTE, presented some more current elements that were developed. He has worked on a very important issue, which is the role of Portuguese as a frank language, which was for a few centuries in Asia. The exchange between Dutch and the kingdom of Zion was made in Portuguese, because it was the common language used at that time, before English became the contemporary frank language. Therefore, there is a whole interesting story of Portuguese and the role it had in the first pinyins that existed, with the Chinese and the use of the [Roman] alphabet in Vietname. There are a number of elements that are not, therefore, very publicized, and the work of Atlas is the same, to disclose some economic dimensions of the language. What are these dimensions? One is the exchange of foreign trade and investment, which is very facilitated by the language. We also talk about migrations, tourism, students' exchange that is greatly influenced by linguistic proximity. Therefore, today we have a set of elements that are very interesting, and we hope to develop some more important partnerships with Macau. As? More at work, Professor Luís Reto is doing, which maintains an investigation team about the value of Portuguese. He has collaborated with the Portuguese Language Museum of São Paulo, for example. It is a museum space that was renewed after the fire that destroyed it. In addition, there is a project with Cascais City Council to develop such a structure, and we hope to do some works with Macau, in order to create three poles for the projection of the Portuguese language. As for Atlas' materials, we would like to have a continued update model, as this data is out of date very quickly. The work was edited in many languages, including Mandarin. This is the moment when we would like to give the book a more historical and deep dimension, with more knowledge about the teaching of Portuguese in the world. What balance does this teaching do today? Portuguese is developing a great deal of mother tongue and is effectively one of the most expanding languages ​​due to demographic growth in Africa, with countries such as Angola and Mozambique, which around 2050 will have populations of over 100 million inhabitants, each. The Portuguese thus consolidates itself as a language of the southern hemisphere, but much more from Africa, supplanting Brazil itself as the place of largest number of speakers of the language. All of this generates enormous potential, and this also occurs due to the great exchange of universities and internationalization of teaching. Today there is the possibility of Portuguese being a language of science, there is more publications in this language. This is a great challenge because English is the contemporary language of scientists. We want to contribute to all these dimensions, and Macau can also play an important role there. Macao is indeed a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, and can play a significant role. Is Macao an ideal place to train Portuguese teachers who do not have Portuguese as a mother tongue? Do you fear that the territory loses relevance in this matter before the offer of courses in the interior of China? I see this question more as complementarity than competition. We have identified about 60 higher education institutions in China that have Portuguese courses, but I think Macau has very interesting conditions to start teaching from primary to secondary education so that children have been able to have learning from an early age. It does not mean that there are no young Chinese who began to learn their tongue in adolescence that they speak fantastically, which surprises me, but it is easier to start earlier and earlier. This will be easier in Macau. What is important is to create conditions for greater economic collaboration to many levels, such as joint research. In this respect, Macau has a very interesting opportunity. At the City of Macau University we are very interested in increasingly collaborating with researchers who visit us and work with our teams. Can you give me examples? Brazil is today one of China's great business partners. There is a lot of exchange in both directions, but one of the themes that is little studied, and in which I work hard, is the internationalization of Chinese companies. To what extent do these companies follow a model of internationalization similar to that of other countries that started this process earlier? I speak of the United States of America, the European countries, but also of Japan and others. China has, in fact, different models of presence in countries that are not yet well known, and this is important to realize, so that we know how to facilitate this process of exchange in a world that lives periods of some setback. It is very sad. I always remember a great economist of Portuguese origin, David Ricardo, who clearly explained how world trade is beneficial to everyone and how countries can take advantage of this situation. Therefore, applying tariffs, making such commercial barriers harms countries that are major exporters, such as China or Germany, and countries that today have a cultural export capacity, for example, and are not just importers. In relation to the new Orthographic Agreement. It continues without a standardization in Macau. Does it worry it? Languages ​​are dynamic and cannot be controlled. We think today in English, and we realize that there are almost incomprehensible ways to each other, such as the English one in Nigeria or Australia. Americans have difficulty realizing the Australians. In the nineteenth century, Portuguese from Portugal and Brazil were closer, then some disagreement emerged. There was an effort in Brazil to propose an orthographic agreement, and the Portuguese joined, resulting in a series of negotiations. There have always been resistances. I remember that Fernando Pessoa suggested the famous phrase “My homeland is the Portuguese language”. It was curiously a manifestation of some conservatism, because he thought Pharmacy had to continue writing with pH [Pharmacia]. In fact it did not make much sense. Portugal ended up seeking to impose a certain standardization based on the most genetic changes in the spelling agreement. It is not a process that has been running a hundred percent well, and has been universally adopted. African countries have become more defenders of Portuguese from Portugal. There is sometimes some confusion, but I understand that intercomprehension still remains, achieving a homogeneous language, more perhaps than English.
Between words and numbers José Paulo Esperança is a doctorate in Economics from the European University Institute and was president of the ISCTE Department of Finance and Accounting - University Institute of Lisbon. The “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, with editions in 2016 and 2018, contains “a large set of indicators that reinforce the idea of ​​the growth of teaching, speakers and the written use of Portuguese in the world”, having been the target of a series of recent initiatives in Macao. One of them took place on March 17, at the Rui Cunha Foundation, with a session of the “Roda de Ideas” cycle, entitled “The Potential of the Portuguese Language in the Contemporary World”, which was attended by the former Rector of ISCTE, Luís Reto, and José Paulo Esperança himself. In addition to the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, José Paulo Esperança is the author of other works in the financial area.

item.title: Vera Lúcia Raposo, jurist and teacher: “It was propagated today as a virus”

The former Macao University officer argues that China is gaining the race in an area that has never been so present in our lives
Spoke on Wednesday of “Ai Act” approved by the European Union (EU). Specifically, what are the main points of this document? It is a European law, but it is also, so far, the most detailed legal regime about the products surrounding AI. Is it difficult to legislate on the AI ​​at this preliminary phase? Maybe we will never stop being at this stage. Notice, AI did not come up with ChatgPT or anything that looks like. We are currently in a kind of pandemic, where AI propagates in our existence as a virus, but not a bad virus, because I understand that the AI ​​often propagates with positive effects. But this is understood in very comprehensive terms, not only security as we are used to thinking about it, as something that calls into question physical integrity, but covers environmental issues, respect for fundamental values ​​and technology rights and data protection. This idea comes, by the way, in the report of Mario Draghi, who warned the EU to the ability to mortgage future generations because we are leaving innovation behind. I don't see that any of these three technological models [US, China and EU] be particularly fruitful because they have benefits and disadvantages. We have an interesting model, which is the British.
